paper_abstract: The following problem, arising from medical imaging, is addressed: Suppose that T is a known tetrahedron in a"e(3) with centroid at the origin. Also known is the orthogonal projection U of the vertices of the image I center dot T of T under an unknown rotation I center dot about the origin. Under what circumstances can I center dot be determined from T and U?.
paper_title: Determining a Rotation of a Tetrahedron from a Projection
